title: Morocco: Citi Foundation Supports Injaz Al Maghrib in the Launch of New Educational Programs
summary: Casablanca - The Citi Foundation announced a grant of US$40,000 this year in support of several educational programs set forth by Injaz Al Maghrib, including "Entrepreneurship Masterclass," "Success Skills" and "Banks in Action."
tag-1: Morocco: Citi Foundation Supports Injaz Al Maghrib in the Launch of New Educational Programs
tag-2: Casablanca – The Citi Foundation announced a grant of US$40,000 this year in support of several educational programs set forth by Injaz Al Maghrib, including "Entrepreneurship Masterclass," "Success Skills" and "Banks in Action."
tag-3: More than 2,450 junior high school students will participate this year in the Entrepreneurship Masterclass program, sponsored by the Citi Foundation and Citi Morocco, and organized by Injaz Al Maghrib, a member of Junior Achievement Worldwide, the world's largest organization dedicated to educating young people about business and economics. The Masterclass seminar aims to enhance the economic opportunities available to students. The sessions enable participants to identify key entrepreneurial attitudes and skills, as well as understand main issues and practicalities required to start their own business.
tag-4: "Success skills" will expand learning knowledge to about 500 high school students by providing engaging, academically enriching and practical learning sessions in work-readiness education and career perspectives. This is done through eight, hour-and-a-half required volunteer sessions.
tag-5: The "Banks in Action" program, launched four years ago, is being taught to 600 high-school students this year. It is a program of eight sessions, with each lasting two hours. Citi Morocco volunteers and others teach the basics of banking. The program incorporates virtual simulations and competitions in which students assume banker role and make strategic decisions.
tag-6: These programs have proven highly effective in the 120 member countries where the organization is present. Research studies have shown that 30 percent of the students who have enrolled in one of these programs create their own startup companies by the age of 25. The local NGO, Injaz Al Maghrib, plans to provide adequate training to 8,900 students this year, up 60 percent from last year. To increase the scope of the students being attracted by the programs offered, Injaz is opening an office in Tangiers, in addition to the Rabat and Casablanca offices already operational.
tag-7: Mr. Abbad Andaloussi, Chairman of Injaz Al Maghrib, said, "We have a very aggressive plan with 100,000 students in total who will have completed the program by 2015. We will open the Tangiers office in October 2011 with the support of Tangier Free Zone (TGZ) and Tangier Med Port Authority (TMPA). Injaz Al Maghrib is proud to partner with the Citi Foundation and Citi, and is grateful to all volunteers and partner institutions that have supported the development of its activities in Morocco."
tag-8: "I am pleased that all these programs have been launched this year, and I am quite confident that they will have a great impact on students at all levels of high school. Our Citi Morocco volunteers are taking the lead in all these initiatives and have been actively involved in providing assistance and classes for both the Company Program and Banks in Action program. We are delighted that the student population has shown such interest in these programs. Citi is proud to support Injaz Al Maghreb since 2008, and our total contribution toward their programs has reached US$175,000 since it was established in 2007," said Walter Siouffi, General Manager, Citibank Maghreb (Citi Morocco).
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-11: Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
tag-12: Injaz Al Maghrib Founded in 2007, Injaz Al Maghrib is a local non-governmental and non-profit organization that works to bridge the gap between the educational field and the market place through extra-curricular programs that empower the youth and nurture their entrepreneurial spirit. The implementation of their programs is based on the "Learning by doing" methodology. Injaz AL Maghrib is a member of Junior Achievement Worldwide, the world's largest educational organization dedicated to workforce readiness, entrepreneurship and financial learning, founded in 1919 and present in 124 countries.
